properties.Name: Egg Harbor Municipal Marina
properties.description:
Egg Harbor

The Egg Harbor Municipal Marina in Door County has a boat ramp and boarding dock open to the public. Parking is available, and there is a launch fee. For more information call (920) 868-2048

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Hika Park Access
properties.description:
Hika Park Access

The Hika Park boat access is in the Village of Cleveland, in Manitowoc County. The site has a boat ramp and boarding dock open to the public. Vault restrooms are available.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Saxon Harbor Access
properties.description:
Saxon Harbor Access

The Saxon Harbor Access is in the Town of Saxon, Iron County. The site has three paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock open to the public. Vault restrooms are available. For more information call the Forestry and Parks Department (715) 561-2697.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Saxon Falls Flowage Access
properties.description:
Saxon Falls Flowage Access

The Saxon Falls Flowage Access is in the Town of Saxon, Iron County. The site has one paved boat ramp lane. No boarding dock or restrooms are available.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bender Park Boat Launch
properties.description:
Bender Park Boat Launch

The Bender Park Boat Launch is in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County. The site has more than five paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock open to the public. The launch depth is about three feet deep, depending on the lake level. Flush restrooms are available, and the site is ADA accessible. For more information call Milwaukee County Parks (414) 257-7275.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Port Washington - Lake Michigan
properties.description:
Port Washington - Lake Michigan

The Port Washington Access is in the City of Port Washington, Ozaukee County. The site has more than five paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock open to the public. Flush restrooms are available, and there is a fish cleaning area. The launch depth is deeper than three feet.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lake Michigan Access
properties.description:
Lake Michigan Access (Name Unkown)

A small launch site in the City of Sheboygan with one boat ramp.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Peshtigo Harbor Access
properties.description:
Peshtigo Harbor Access

The Peshtigo Harbor Access is in the Town of Peshtigo, Marinette County. The site has one boat ramp lane on the Peshtigo River. No restrooms are available. For more information call the Wisconsin DNR area Wildlife Biologist (715) 582-5047.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Metro Boat Launch
properties.description:
Metro Boat Launch

The Metro Boat Launch is on the Fox River in Brown County. The site has more than five paved boat ramp lanes and an ADA accessible boarding dock. The launch depth is greater than three feet, and there is a launching fee. Flush restrooms are available. For more information call the Parks, Recreation and Forestry Department (920) 448-3365.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Jackson Harbor Access
properties.description:
Jackson Harbor Access

The Jackson Harbor Access is on the northeast side of Washington Island, at the tip of the Door County peninsula. There is a boarding dock and potable water. The site is within Rock Island State Park. For more information call theWisconsin State DNR (920) 847-2235.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Two Creeks Access
properties.description:
Two Creeks Access

Two Creeks Access is in the Town of Two Creeks, Manitowoc County. The site has one gravel launch lane and a boarding dock. The launch is in less than three feet of water, and is unprotected. Launching may be difficult if the waves on Lake Michigan are larger than three feet.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: West Shore Access
properties.description:
West Shore Access

The West Shore Access is in the Town of Suamico, Brown County. The site has one boat ramp lane, with an unimproved surface, and is not ADA accessible. There is no boarding dock or restrooms. The ramp should be used as carry-in access when water levels are low.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Tennison Bay Ramp
properties.description:
Tennison Bay

The Tennison Bay Ramp is in the Town of Gibraltar, Door County. The site has one carry-in ramp with an unimproved surface, and is unusable at low water levels (except for canoes and kayaks). Flush restrooms are available. For more information call the Wisconsin State DNR (928) 868-3258.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Barkers Island Marina
properties.description:
Barkers Island Marina

Barkers Island Marina is in the City of Superior, Douglas County. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The Marina is ADA accessible, and portable restrooms are available. For more information call the Superior Parks and Recreation Department (715) 395-7270

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Loonsfoot Landing
properties.description:
Loonsfoot Landing

Loonsfoot Landing is in the City of Superior, Douglas County. The site has four paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The landing is ADA accessible, and flush restrooms are available. For more information call the Superior Parks and Recreation Department (715) 395-7270

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Olde Stone Quarry Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Olde Stone Quarry Park Ramp

The Olde Stone Quarry Ramp is in the Town of Sevastopol on Sturgeon Bay. The site has four paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The launch depth is greater than three feet deep. For more information call the Door County Parks Department (920) 746-9959

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Shauer Park Ramp
properties.description:
Shauer Park Ramp

Shauer Park Ramp is in the Town of Jacksonport, in Door County. The site has one boat ramp lane and a boarding dock. The launch depth is shallow, and should not be used at low water levels, except for canoes and kayaks.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Ephraim Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Ephraim Boat Ramp

The Ephraim Ramp is in the Village of Ephraim on Green Bay, Door County. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. There is a launching fee.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Herbster Landing
properties.description:
Herbster Landing

Herbster Landing is in the Town of Clover, Bayfield County. The site has a paved boat ramp in less than three feet of water. Vault restrooms are available. There is a campground with electricity adjacent to the landing. The site is not ADA accessible.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lake Superior Access
properties.description:
Lake Superior Access

The Lake Superior Access Ramp is in the City of Ashland, Ashland County. The site has one paved ramp lane and a boarding dock. There are no restrooms available.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lake Michigan Access
properties.description:
Lake Michigan Access (Peshtigo)

The Lake Michigan Access in the Town of Peshtigo, Marinette County is a carry-in only site. The launch surface is unimproved, and the water depth is less than three feet. There are no restrooms and the site is not ADA accessible. For more information call the Wisconsin State DNR (715) 582-5047.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Simmons Island Boat Harbor
properties.description:
Simmons Island Boat Harbor

Simmons Island Harbor is in the City of Kenosha, Kenosha County. The site has four paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The harbor is ADA accessible, and flush restrooms as well as fish cleaning areas are available. There is a launch fee. For more information call the City of Kenosha (262) 654-0207.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: South Shore Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
South Shore Park Boat Ramp

The South Shore Park Ramp is in the City of Milwaukee, and provides access to Lake Michigan from the protected side of a jetty. There are four paved boat launch lanes and a boarding dock. Flush toilets and a fish cleaning area are available. For more information call Milwaukee County Parks (414) 257-7275.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Little River Access
properties.description:
Little River Access

The Little River Access Ramp is near the Town of Peshtigo, Marinette County. The site has a paved boat ramp lane and a boarding dock. Vault restrooms are available. For more information call the Marinette County Assistant Parks Administrator (715) 732-7530.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Breakwater Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Breakwater Park Boat Ramp

The Breakwater Park Boat Ramp is in the City of Oconto, at the base of a deep channel leading into Lake Michigan. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The launch is ADA accessible, and flush restrooms are available. For more information call the City of Oconto Parks Department (920) 834-7732.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Chaudiors Dock Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Chaudiors Dock Park Boat Ramp

Chaudiors Dock Park is in the Town of Union, Door County. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. Vault restrooms are available. Fishing is allowed from the breakwall and shoreline, although a fee is required. For more information call the Door County Parks Department (920) 746-9959.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Frank E. Murphy County Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Frank E. Murphy County Park Boat Ramp

The Frank E. Murphy Park Ramp is in the Town of Egg Harbor, Door County. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The launch can be somewhat difficult to use at lower water levels, and there is a launch fee. For more information call the Door County Parks Department (920) 746-9959.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Liberty Grove Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Liberty Grove Boat Ramp

The Liberty Grove Boat Ramp is in the Town of Liberty Grove on Ellison Bay, Door County. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The launch area is deeper than three feet and poses no hazards at lower lake levels.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Sugar Creek Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Sugar Creek Park Ramp

The Sugar Creek Boat Ramp is in the Town of Gardner on Green Bay. The site has two gravel boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. The launch is suitable for small boats only. Vault restrooms are available. For more information contact the Door County Parks Department (920) 746-9959.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bayfield City Boat Launch
properties.description:
Bayfield City Boat Launch

The Bayfield City Launch is in downtown Bayfield, in close proximity to the Madeline Island Ferry. It has two paved ramp lanes and a boarding dock. There are no restrooms and parking is limited to two days. For further information contact the City of Bayfield (715) 779-5712.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lake Superior Access
properties.description:
Lake Superior Access

This access ramp is just outside the City of Ashland. The site has two paved boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. There is a boat wash area available to remove exotic species. Portable restrooms are on site and the launch is ADA accessible. For more information contact the Ashland County Forestry and Recreation Department (715) 769-3777.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lake Michigan Access
properties.description:
Lake Michigan Access

This access point is in the Town of Pensaukee, Oconto County. The site is a primitive launch, and is carry-in only.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Deland Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Deland Park Boat Ramp

The Deland Park Ramp is in the City of Sheboygan, and is sheltered from Lake Michigan by a long breakwater. The site has more than five boat ramp lanes and a boarding dock. There is a launching fee and fish cleaning area. Flush restrooms are available. For more information contact City of Sheboygan Planning Department (920) 459-3366.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: D.E. Hall Park
properties.description:
D.E. Hall Park

D.E. Hall Park is in the Town of Little River, Oconto County. The site has one gravel boat ramp. The launch is primitive, and best suited for carry-in access when water levels are low. There are camping and picnic areas nearby. For more information contact the Oconto County Forestry, Parks and Recreation Department (920) 834-6995.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Cecil Depeau Bay Shore Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Cecil Depeau Bay Shore Park

The Cecil Depeau Park Boat Ramp is southwest of the town of Dyckesville on Green Bay. The site has four paved launch lanes and a boarding dock. There is a launching fee. Vault restrooms are available. For more information contact the Brown County Parks Department (920) 448-4466.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Red River Park
properties.description:
Red River Park

The Red River Park Ramp is in the town of Red River on Lake Michigan. The site has two gravel launch lanes and a boarding dock. Vault restrooms are available. For more information contact the Kewaunee County Promotions and Recreation Department (920) 388-0444.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Ern-Joys
properties.description:
Ern-Joys

The Ern-Joys boat ramp is in the Town of Gardner, Door County. The site hast one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. There are no restrooms, and the boat launch is considered crude. It should be used for small boats only.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bues Point Ramp
properties.description:
Bues Point Ramp

The Bues Point Ramp is near the Town of Baileys Harbor, on the east side of the Door County Peninsula. There is one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. Parking is available on the side of town road, and a fee is required.

The Bues Point Ramp can be used as a sheltered launch site when there are strong winds and waves out of the north.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bailey's Harbor Access
properties.description:
Bailey's Harbor Access

The Bailey's Harbor Ramp is in the Town of Bailey's Harbor, on the east side of the Door County Peninsula. The site has two paved launch lanes and a boarding dock. There is a launching fee. Car and trailer parking is available one block west of the ramp

This ramp is sheltered from strong winds and waves out of the north and south, and has a deep launch depth that can accomodate mid-sized boats.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Washington Island Access
properties.description:
Washington Island Access

The Washington Island Boat Ramp is near the Town of Washington, on the south side of Washington Island. The launch is in shallow water, and is ADA accessible. The ramp provides access to Detroit Harbor, which is sheltered from Lake Michigan on its north, west, and east sides.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Washburn Marina Access
properties.description:
Washburn Marina Accessk

The Washburn Marina Ramp is in the City of Washburn, in Bayfield County. The site has one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. There are no bathrooms, overnight parking, camping or fires.

The marina allows independent haulers only.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Little Sand Bay Access
properties.description:
Little Sand Bay Access

The Little Sand Bay Boat Ramp is near the Town of Russel in Bayfield County. There is one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. Vault restrooms are available, and the site is ADA accessible.

Use of personal watercraft (e.g. jet skis) is prohibited, and there is a seven day stay limit. A very shallow area to the west between Little Sand Island and the main land should be avoided in rough weather.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: North Bay Shore Recreation Area Boat Ramp
properties.description:
North Bay Shore Recreation Area

The North Bay Shore Boat Ramp is near the Town of Little River in Oconto County. There are four paved launch lanes and a boarding dock. Flush restrooms are available and the site is ADA accessible.

The launch ramp is sheltered, however care should be taken in accessing Green Bay when there are strong winds or waves out of the south. For more information contact the Oconto County Forestry, Parks and Recreation Department (920) 834-6995.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Lily Bay Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Lily Bay Park

The Lily Bay Park Boat Ramp is near the Town of Sturgeon Bay in Door County. There are two launch lanes and a boarding dock. The boat launch should be used for small boats only, and there is no protection from wind or waves. The site should be used in good weather only. For more information contact the Door County Parks Department (920) 746-9959.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Long Bridge Access
properties.description:
Long Bridge Access

The Long Bridge Boat Ramp is near the Town of Barksdale in Bayfield County. There is one launch lane on a sand beach, and no boarding dock. No restrooms are available, and the site is not ADA accessible.

The launch can be accessed by turning onto Long Bridge Road on the west side of the bridge. For further information contact the Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources Forestry Department (715) 373-6165.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Onion River Access
properties.description:
Onion River Access

The Onion River Access Site is near the Town of Bayview in Bayfield County. The site is a carry-in launch in shallow water at the outlet of the Onion River. There are no restrooms or ADA accessible features. For more information contact the Wisconsin State DNR Forester (715) 373-6165.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Squaw Bay Access
properties.description:
Squaw Bay Access

The Squaw Bay Access is a carry-in only site in shallow water near the Town of Bayfield. There are no restrooms or ADA accessible features. The launch can be accessed by a set of stairs leading to the shore at the end of Meyers Road.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Kreher Park Boat Landing
properties.description:
Kreher Park Boat Ramp

The Kreher Park launch is in the City of Ashland. There are two paved launch lanes and a boarding dock. Flush toilets are available, and the site is ADA accessible. The city does not allow power loading at the ramp. For further information contact the City of Ashland Parks Department (715) 682-7061.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: North Bay Lake Michigan Boat Ramp
properties.description:
North Bay Boat Ramp

The North Bay Boat Launch is near the Town of Liberty Grove on the east side of the Door County Peninsula. The site can accomodate small to medium sized boats, and is sheltered from strong wind and waves out of the north.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Whitefish Bay Ramp
properties.description:
Whitefish Bay Ramp

The Whitefish Bay Boat Ramp is in the Town of Sevastopol on the east side of the Door County Peninsula. There is one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. Ramp is unusable at low water levels, but can still accomodate carry-in canoe or kayak launches. Caution should be exercised in rough weather.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Red Arrow Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Red Arrow Park

The Red Arrow Park Boat Ramp is in the City of Manitowoc at the east end of Green Street. There is one paved launch lane and flush restrooms are available. The launch is in shallow water and care should be taken when there are strong onshore/east winds. For more information contact the City of Manitowoc Parks Division (920) 683-4530.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Port Wing Marina Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Port Wing Marina

The Port Wing Marina Ramp is in the Town of Port Wing at the outlet of the Flag River. There is one paved launch lane in deep water. A boarding dock and portable restrooms are present. The site does not have ADA accessible features.

There is a $10.00 day/overnight docking fee, and a $35.00 penalty for failure to pay. Docking is limited to 48 hours.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bark Bay Slough Access
properties.description:
Bark Bay Slough Access

The Bark Bay Slough Access is near the Town of Clover in Bayfield County. There is one paved launch lane without a boarding dock. The site is not ADA accessible.

Full access to Lake Superior requires navigation of a narrow channel to the south east, or a portage over a narrow strip of land directly to the east. For more information contact the Wisconsin State DNR Forester (715) 373-6165.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Hot Pond Overlook Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Hot Pond Overlook Ramp

The Hot Pond Overlook is in the City of Ashland, at the corner of 11th Avenue and Lake Shore Drive West. There is one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. No restrooms are available. For further information contact the City of Ashland Parks Department (715) 682-7061.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Pershing Park Lake Michigan Access
properties.description:
Pershing Park Boat Ramps

The Pershing Park Boat Ramps are in the City of Racine on the south side of the city harbor. There are more than five paved launch lanes in deep water with boarding docks. Flush restrooms and a fish cleaning area are available. There is also a launch fee.

This site provides sheltered access to Lake Michigan. For further information contact the City of Racine Parks Department (262) 636-9131.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: McKinley Park Marina
properties.description:
McKinley Park Marina

The McKinley Park Boat Ramp is in the City of Milwaukee next to a large marina and shoreline parks. There are more than five paved boat ramps in deep water with boarding docks. Flush restrooms and a fish cleaning area are available. The site is ADA accessible.

Fishing along the adjacent jetty is allowed. For further information contact Milwaukee County Parks (414) 257-7275.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bois Brule River Mouth Access
properties.description:
Bois Brule River Mouth

The Bois Brule River Mouth Access is near the Town of Cloverland in Douglas County. There is one gravel launch lane without a boarding dock. Vault restrooms are available.

The ramp is located at the end of South Brule River Road. Caution should be used in rough weather as waves and currents may pose a threat. For further information contact the Wisconsin State DNR (715) 372-5678.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Red Arrow Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Red Arrow Park Boat Ramp

The Red Arrow Park Boat Ramp is in the City of Marinette, at the east end of Bird Street. There are two paved launch lanes in deep water. Vault restrooms are available.

An annual or daily launch permit is required. Full access to Lake Michigan requires navigation of a channel and some shallow areas on the southwest side of the launch. For further information contact the City of Marinette Recreation Department (715) 732-5222.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Algoma Marina
properties.description:
Algoma Marina

The Algoma Marina Boat Launch is in the City of Algoma at the east end of Steele Street. There are four paved launch lanes with boarding docks. Flush restrooms and a fish cleaning area are available. The site is ADA accessible. For further information contact the Algoma Marina (920) 487-2232.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Fish Creek Ramp
properties.description:
Fish Creek Ramp

The Fish Creek Boat Ramp is in the Town of Gibraltar on the west side of the Door County Peninsula, and provides sheltered access to Green Bay. There are two paved launch lanes with a boarding dock. Parking is available several blocks away from the ramp, and a fee is required.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Nicolet Bay Access
properties.description:
Nicolet Bay Access

The Nicolet Bay Boat Ramp is near the Town of Gibraltar, on the west side of the Door County Peninsula. There are two paved launch lanes with a boarding dock. The site is ADA accessible and vault restrooms are available. Overflow parking is available less than a kilometer away, and a State Park sticker is required. For further information contact Peninsula State Park (920) 868-3258.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Sister Bay Marina
properties.description:
Sister Bay Marina

The Sister Bay Marina is located in the Village of Sister Bay on the west side of the Door County Peninsula. The marina has four paved launch lanes with boarding docks. Car and trailer parking is available 1-2 blocks east of the ramp. A launch fee is required.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Thompsons West End Park Boat Launch
properties.description:
Thompson's West End Park

The boat launch at Thompson's West End Park is located in the City of Washburn at the south end of 6th Avenue. There are two paved launch lanes with a boarding dock. Portable restrooms are available on-site. There is a launch fee and fishing pier nearby. For further information contact the City of Washburn (715) 373-6160.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Red Cliff
properties.description:
Red Cliff Boat Launch

The Red Cliff Boat Ramp is located in Red Cliff off of Church Road and Camper Drive. There is one paved launch lane and a boarding dock. Flush restrooms are available on site. The ramp and dock are not ADA accessible.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bono Creek Access
properties.description:
Bono Creek Access

The Bono Creek Boat Ramp is near the Town of Barksdale in Bayfield. There is one paved launch lane without a boarding dock. No restrooms or ADA accessible features are available.

The area around the launch is shallow, and may only be suitable for carry-in launches at lower water levels. For further information contact the Wisconsin State DNR Forester (715) 373-6165.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bell Marina, Cornucopia Access
properties.description:
Bell Marina, Cornucopia Access

The Bell Marina Boat Ramp is located in the Town of Bell on the west side of the Bayfield Peninsula. There is one paved launch lane with a boarding dock. No restrooms or ADA accessible features are available.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Bark Point Boat Landing
properties.description:
Bark Point Boat Landing

The Bark Point Boat Landing is in the Town of Clover, just off of Bark Point Road on the southeast side of the peninsula. There is one paved launch lane with a boarding dock. No restrooms or ADA accessible features are available.

The launch is in deep water, and is protected from strong winds and waves out of the north and west.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access

properties.Name: Myers Park Boat Ramp
properties.description:
Myers Park Boat Ramp

The Myers Park Boat Ramp is in the City of Racine at the south end of Pershing Drive. There is one launch lane without a boarding dock. The site is better suited for smaller boats, and the launch area is protected by a long rock jetty. For further information contact the City of Racine Parks Department (262) 636-9131.

Visit the Wisconsin DNR website for additional information about Public Boat Access

DNR Boat Access
